website_summaries.verdict: Great for skiing and snowboarding, these double-layer gloves give you options for wear depending on the temperature.
pros: Synthetic leather is  touchscreen compatible, and palms are grippy
You can wear the glove-style liner, shell, or both
Can remove mitts but keep gloves on to adjust goggles without exposing skin
Sizes XS to XL and two color choices
cons: Liners are not attached to the wrist leash
Touchscreen compatibility is for the glove liner, not the mitt

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Mittens!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite mittens. Seriously the best, in my opinion and I have been doing ski/snowboard sports for years. I really like these because of the features and variety of colors/patterns. The wrist strap is especially useful, since I frequently take off the gloves during a typical snowboarding day. Since I frequently take off the gloves, having the liners underneath is a necessity. My phone's touch screen isn't super responsive to these gloves, but I don't mind much. There are two a cinches to keep the snow out of your mittens and the mittens on your hands...has a small pocket for hand warmers. Very warm and waterproof, would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Mitts over gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and warm too. Wore this in -30degree Celsius condition and felt great. The pocket at the top for warmer-packs adds to the comfort. The additional pair liner that came attached to these mitts helped when I got my mitts off to take pictures. Not a problem in handling alloy tripods - they would stick to the pole. Also, mitts do provide more warmth than gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Lim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are amazing! I get cold so easily when skiing usually with my hands getting cold first and making the trip nonenjoyable. These gloves changed all that! My hands stay warm all day long. The liners are great because if I have to fix my goggles or just to check my phone I still have something on my hands not having to expose my skin to the cold. I can't recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Cold weather? What cold weather?
customer_reviews.text: What warm mittens! Soft liner gloves, that don't crowd your hand inside the mitten. Can even go with just the liners on a less tundra-like day! These gloves are durable. After a full day of snow tubing, gloves still appear new! Love the 2 fully adjustable wrist pulls that you can tighten/loosen easily, even with mittens on. The only fault I can find with ease gloves is that I wish the cuffs were a bit longer, even an inch would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kimbro

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these mittens! I have large hands and an autoimmune disease that makes it so I need things that aren't tight but are warm. I looked all over for mittens that would fit, be super comfortable, and be warm. These fit the bill to a T!! I don't use the liners that come with them often, but it's cool how grippy the fingers on them are. They grip really well without having any sticky residue.
customer_reviews.author: Bec

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Currently 15 degrees Fahrenheit in Upstate NY (Syracuse). Went out to shovel the driveway and give my new $70 Burton mittens a text run. Garbage. Don't waste your money. My hands were cold within 5 minutes. I will be returning these. The search continues. It's going to be 8 degrees here next week.
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Burton mitts have very good quality. I compared Dakine and Burton, they both make good gloves and mitts, but I love Burton more because the design allows you quickly wear it on or off. Gore-Tex is the main reason I chose it especially my GF's hands always get cold. The liner is good too but unfortunately, without touchscreen control function, only the mitt palm does. Great mitts!
customer_reviews.author: birdbar

customer_reviews.title: Hand warmer pocket on fingers
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for nighttime outdoor activities in Tromsø, Norway in March, where it was -6C/21.2F. The hand warmer pockets actually allowed the warmth to warm my fingers, unlike other gloves that just made the warmers sit on the back of my hand. The touchscreen feature also works great, but the liners that come with the gloves are not touchscreen friendly at all and hence completely useless; I used black diamond screentap gloves as liners instead.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Not very warm!
customer_reviews.text: Worn once, these mitts, with the thin liners underneath, did not keep my hands warm during my mile walk from the commuter train to the office. I bought them to wear while winter hiking, but I'll keep searching for a warmer pair. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: th

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and the liner glove is great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mittens for skiing in Northern Michigan. I have Lyme Disease and my body does not regulate temperature well. When the rest of my family is just fine, I’m cold. These gloves kept my hand warm most of the time. We had a cold snap and woke up one morning to temps in the single digits. I didn’t put hand warmers in my gloves and my hands froze. By mid-afternoon it had warmed up some and I was fine. So single digits you may need a hand warmer. Other than that my hands were warm the whole vacation. That means a lot since I am always cold!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Warm, size as expected, very high quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed seriously warm winter gloves for low and sub-zero temperatures. Burton is a high-quality brand, and this was so worth the money! The inner lining can be used separately and/or with the mitten—meaning more warmth but also versatility when you need to pull off the mitten and do something with dexterity. I am delighted with them! They are also quite beautiful, as photos show/as advertised. Highly recommend! I am 5' 3" and rather petite. I got the XS and they fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: "kwist"

customer_reviews.title: warm and multi use
customer_reviews.text: these gloves are worth the price. love the liner. my son has small hands (6th grader) so he has been using these for snowbooarding. when he outgrows them i can't wait to get these as hand me downs. he uses the liners for practicing basketball outside because they are thin but have rubber grips around them so it's doubling down as a sports glove. i felt his hands on the slopes and they were WARM! he said they were the warmest he's ever used mittens or gloves. only issue is getting the 2nd one on - but i reckon that is probably a common issue with most mittens.
customer_reviews.author: bichonmom

customer_reviews.title: Dollar Store quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap imports. Seem like imitation Burton gloves? No liners came with gloves and should have. Packaged poorly. Highly recommend going to a real ski shop for gloves. $65 gloves that are worth about $35.
customer_reviews.author: Xquizit

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought these, though they seemed like a big investment at the time. My hands were always cold when walking or working outdoors on cold winter days. (We do have some in north Georgia!) Finally, that problem is solved. Haven't had to use hand warmers inside the mittens yet, but there's plenty of room when I do. It's easy to slip off a mitten when I need more dexterity just with gloves. Recently I had to do some work outside in the snow, and it was fabulous to be wearing really waterproof mittens.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Jo Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Size Difference in Width Only, Not Length
customer_reviews.text: My hands are small but I bought first these mittens in a Large because I followed the size chart. The width was fine in the Large but the length very long. I kept the Large and ordered these mittens in a Small. The Small size is smaller in width but only 1/4" shorter in length than the Large! Guess these mitts are for women with very long fingers and/or nails? Have not worn these mittens yet skiing or walking the dog in below freezing temps with wind so cannot comment on warmth factor.
customer_reviews.author: Sogoli

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and super warm
customer_reviews.text: I live in MN and these gloves work great to keep my hands warm and to block the cold winter wind! I ended up buying a longer pair of thin gloves to wear underneath so they would come up further on my wrist, so I don't wear the inserts that came with these gloves. But I have also worn these alone while shoveling snow and they still kept my hands warm! I'm very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Practical
customer_reviews.text: These mittens are perfect for cold weather walking! I like the idea of the glove liner--I can remove the mittens when I need to, yet not have my hands get cold because the I'm able to still wear the liners. I originally ordered the small but returned them for the extra small. The measurements seem a bit off, in my opinion. The mittens are constructed well and appear to offer many years of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Chel Mare

customer_reviews.title: great pair
customer_reviews.text: Used the size scale, they feel slightly larger than expected but still works well. Overall great mittens, the strap across the wrist helps make sure they are snug and keep the snow out. Spent several hours snowboarding and my hands were toasty the whole time. Extra fleece gloves come with it for additional warmth. Definitely a great product for super cold days and just a great pair of mittens.
customer_reviews.author: BeaP

customer_reviews.title: No more frost nip!!!
customer_reviews.text: HOLY CRAP. Love these so much. I took these up to the mountains in CO when it was below zero and they kept my hands warm the whole time. Even too warm at points. And this is coming from someone with terrible circulation that has had frost nip with a different brand of mittens and two hand warmers. Would definitely recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Kennard

customer_reviews.title: Very warm, but inner gloves pill
customer_reviews.text: These are super warm and great mittens. My hands were warm during an entire day of snowboarding. The liner gloves are soft and warm but the quality of the material sucks- within a few hours they started pilling. Good for warmth but I don't see the liners holding up for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: iliketoshop.always.

customer_reviews.title: Extra warm and soft
customer_reviews.text: Love the liner gloves. Liner gloves also have grip rubber pattern on palms. Very high quality — fit great. My hands are about 6.5” base of palm to tip of middle finger and the medium fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy R

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time out doors with my dog and my hiking group, so I needed a pair of mittens that will stand up to Minnesota winters. These do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Didier

customer_reviews.title: The pocket for hand warmers is a nice feature, and the removable liners are nice
customer_reviews.text: Very warm - and my hands are always cold. The pocket for hand warmers is a nice feature, and the removable liners are nice. I went skiing at under 20 degrees and was super toasty with these -- maybe even a bit too warm at times. My only issue with these is that they are supposed to be smartphone-compatible, but that does not work very well. Otherwise, I'm happy with the purchase and look forward to using these for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cawley

customer_reviews.title: Oh wow!
customer_reviews.text: We ski a lot as a family and being the mom I'm taking my gloves on and off every few minutes to help adjust my kids gear. I love the liners (just wish the lines had a touch screen finger). But they are so warm and keep me warm even with me taking my gloves on and off so much.
customer_reviews.author: RGar

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm!
customer_reviews.text: These mittens are great. Not too bulky and very warm! I wore them snowmobiling with weather in the teens and my fingers and hands were nice and toasty, later in the day I had to take the glove liners out as my hands were too warm, so you can adjust for temperature as needed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Took these gloves skiing in Utah and wore the liner ...
customer_reviews.text: Took these gloves skiing in Utah and wore the liner glove and the outer shell. They kept our hands warm, but never made them sweaty. The temperatures ranged from the low teens in the morning to 32+ in the day. They kept the wind out going down fast ski runs and allow you to grip your ski poles well. If we can keep up with the liner glove these should last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thumb is tight
customer_reviews.text: When I read the reviews, I thought they fixed the tight thumb issue... but with my mittens, the thumbs are tight with the inserts on . It fits fine without them, but the point is to wear the inserts for added warmth. I probably got older stock. Otherwise I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Skied in negative degree weather. These gloves kept my hands warm! I would take off my gloves to use my phone for taking photos then place my hands back inside my gloves - warmed them right back up. Great quality. I rated 4 stars because I went by the recommended measurements, but turned out to be too big. However, still awesome gloves! I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: rydunnit

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for skiing
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift. The recipient said the liners were too fitting on her hands and caused a medical condition to kind of flair up so she removed the liners and just used the gloves. She said her hands were plenty warm on a week long ski trip in a cold climate with these gloves. She was very happy with them! I would purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: kdw

customer_reviews.title: Don't like these mittens
customer_reviews.text: I hate these mittens. They are not warm and they are not dry. It's impossible to do anything with your hands when you're wearing them. The touchscreen-friendliness is only on the glove liners, which is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, warm, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: With the glove inserts (included), these are the warmest mittens I’ve had. They are waterproof, too—and I’ve been skiing in storm after storm in the west. Very importantly, I can still grip my poles. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Warm ski gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. Pretty color. I live that they come with the liner gloves. Wore these to ski when the temp was -22 in the morning. Put a hand warmer in the top zip pocket on the glove and my hands were warm for the day.
customer_reviews.author: CateG39

customer_reviews.title: Not as tough as I want
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t terrible mittens. The pocket for the heat packs are what sold me and are very useful but I should’ve known with the pocket codes the need for it which means not tough enough. I take these snowmobiling and my fingers especially my thumb got the beginning stages of frost bite. Sooo painful.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Ciardi

customer_reviews.title: I love these mittens
customer_reviews.text: I love these mittens. I snowboard and found that these to be very warm and comfortable. I like the inner glove so that when the weather gets nicer I can only wear the shell.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great mittens!
customer_reviews.text: Was 4 degrees out on the mountain but my hands were warm (didn't even need to put heat packs in). I especially like the quick cinch pull, it's easy to use even though they're mittens.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great ! We go skiing in Michigan and every year my hands end up so cold I have to take breaks... I was told to try mittens so I gave these a try... worth every penny.. I put some hand warmers in there and my hand actually started sweating ! Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: abigail

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife for our trip to Fairbanks, Alaska in early March. She wore them when we played in the snow in temperature below -10 F's and was dry and comfortable. The liner-gloves were convenient when it was not so cold or when finger-dexterity was needed. Buying her these was one more thing that I did right...
customer_reviews.author: P. Jan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Very warm gloves for skiing/snowboarding. I was very impressed by the customer service response when we ran into an issue. Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne R.

customer_reviews.title: Not the warmest but does the job
customer_reviews.text: So I was skiing all day at 32 degrees. My hands were not freezing at any time. But multiple times I had to move my fingers to warm it up. It could be a little more insulated but it was waterproof and windproof all day. But side note my hands get cold so easily. But it’s not the warmest glove they have but it’s good enough to ski when it’s not super cold
customer_reviews.author: Nazli Ucar

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: The product it self wasn't a good quality. Maybe it was just the one I ordered that was really bad quality. But the Amazon made a refund. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: VaNDaL99

customer_reviews.title: Super warm, soft inside
customer_reviews.text: Super warm, soft inside, the liner is really warm and the mitten without them have survived this MN winter so far. Good quality, great style, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mittens, but liners thin
customer_reviews.text: Great mittens, but liners thin. No smart phone abilities in liner either, which is disappointing. For a Raynaud's sufferer, 4 stars is a 10/10 for any normal-circulation people!
customer_reviews.author: DogMom

customer_reviews.title: Great Mittens
customer_reviews.text: They held up to my life as a farmer in Maine. I do have to use a liner and heat packs on the bitter cold days but these gloves are tough. Not one tear
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Nice& warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a VT ski trip last minute when I realized I’d lost my long time gloves. They kept my hands super warm despite a day where it was -6* at the base. Great pouch for handwarmer. Only complaint is that it’s a bit tight to go over jacket so takes some pulling. Otherwise very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth your money for sure!
customer_reviews.text: My fingers are always the first thing to get cold and last thing to get warm. I was tired of having cold fingers in the snow so after reading some of the reviews I took a chance and bought them and I am so glad I did. The liners alone are extremely warm, I wear them by themselves when my hands won't be in the snow. The mittens are just as warm as everyone says, I was out shoveling snow in a blizzard the other day and didn't even think about my hands because they were such a good temp. definitely would recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Iceland winters
customer_reviews.text: So warm and has a zipper to hold hot hand pads. Perfect for Iceland winters and watching northern lights! A must have for cold snowey winters!
customer_reviews.author: Colby1374

customer_reviews.title: Not good for icey temps
customer_reviews.text: These gloves look nice, but they don't keep my fingers warm in cold temperatures. The cold air seeps into the gloves after a few minutes of being outside. They are good for a mild winter day, but not a frigid one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for! These gloves are worth every penny! Love that the inside gloves are separate. My hands are so warm on the slopes! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Love these mittens!
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of mittens and I absolutely love them! The liner gloves are a bit awkward because of the pattern and texture and in my experience did not work with my smartphone. The mittens themselves are great! They kept my hands very warm although they did get wet after a long powder day. I used the hand warmer pocket to put my lift cards and it worked nicely :).
customer_reviews.author: Mariah R.

customer_reviews.title: Faded color after three days. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Only three days snowboarding in these pair, faded color already! Expected more from Burton!
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: so warm and toasty
customer_reviews.text: These mittens are the key to my happiness on the slope! The HotHands pockets changed my life, and I love how you can use a touch screen while wearing them. Only downside are that the liner gloves are nothing special, and surprisingly not touch-capable like the mittens.
customer_reviews.author: star894

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't super cold (low teens F
customer_reviews.text: Just used for spring skiing in Alta and they worked very well. It wasn't super cold (low teens F, at the coldest) but they worked well at that temperature with liner gloves that I bought separately. I also liked that they went over my coat cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: My Wife loves these mittens!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loved these! She also wears the inner removable gloves for driving. These are the best mittens you will find!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Grasser

customer_reviews.title: Floral Color Looks Way Different in Person
customer_reviews.text: This review is about the color only- please see photo. The floral pattern is brown, not purple. It looks nothing like the photo.
customer_reviews.author: APK

customer_reviews.title: Warmest Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These Gloves are the warmest Gloves I have ever owned. I wore them once with the liner in and once without the liner and both times my hands were not cold. My hands are always cold and these mittens are the best purchase. the touch screen however never worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for a high-end brand
customer_reviews.text: I wore the mittens 3 times and the seam ripped. I am a very conservative boarder so I’m not sure how it happened. Very disappointed! Not the quality I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: DayeAnn Walden

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Can fit two hand warmers in each if needed. Comes with nice liners. Works with cell phones.
customer_reviews.author: GA to NJ

customer_reviews.title: My hands are sweating!
customer_reviews.text: These suckers, lemme tell ya. Are the bomb! My hands NEVER got cold! And the features are convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry!
customer_reviews.text: Love that there are 2 glove options! I wear the lighter gloves while commuting to/from work and driving and then the gloves and mitts when shoveling or in the snow, keeps my hands warm and dry in New England winters :)
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Kept hands warm for 5 hours of skiing
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect and the only gloves that have kept my hands warm in a heavy wet powder day in Utah skiing. The inner gloves with sticky pads for using handheld electronics were a bit hard to use. If the sticky areas were smaller it would have worked better.
customer_reviews.author: diane wilson

customer_reviews.title: Warm and flexible
customer_reviews.text: My hands usually get freezing cold and I don’t want to ski for very long. These were perfect ! Also I have trouble holding my ski poles because my hands are very small. Mittens instead of gloves made it much easier !
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Kept my hands warm!!
customer_reviews.text: The fit was perfect...Comes with removable liners which is nice.. Zipper on top where u can put hand warmers... Straps to put around wrist so you don't lose a glove... Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Lukie

customer_reviews.title: Warmest ever!
customer_reviews.text: these are the warmest mittens ever! it was 0-10 degrees the whole ski trip and I was comfortable... highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: YOberry

customer_reviews.title: warm
customer_reviews.text: warm and love the inner gloves. The inner gloves allow you to manipulate a touch screen which is nice. the inner glove though does show wear pretty quick. but I bought these for warmth and they do an excellent job of that
customer_reviews.author: Margaret  Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my hands warm
customer_reviews.text: My hards are usually extremely cold when I ski. With these gloves my hands were almost warm! Very happy about them.

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair!
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Love the gloves inside and the wrist bands. The zipped pockets on top of each are handy too!

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Warm and comfortable, material is truly water prove, also pretty tough especially I use a lot while I holding the snowboard. only thing not give it 5star is the outer gloves size is a bit larger than I expect, but inner one just fit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Yukia

customer_reviews.title: Liners and mittens for perfectly warm hands
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about these gloves. The liners were warm enough in sunny conditions. The mittens did a great job keeping my hands warm and dry all day. The zipper at the top kept my credit and ID card safe. Will get a pair for my husband too.
customer_reviews.author: Eder

customer_reviews.title: Kept me and dry
customer_reviews.text: The fit was a little large, but they still fit me. I wish Jim really warm even without the liners all of the liners did come in handy on a particularly cold day. I also find the liners work has gloves particularly for driving.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves for Skiing
customer_reviews.text: Very warm and soft fleece inside. Bought again to replace a lost glove. I recommend these gloves.

customer_reviews.text: I love the insert glove that these came with. I used these to snowboard on a 30 degree day and they kept my fingers warm and toasty.

product_meta.title: Burton Gore-Tex Mittens Womens
product_meta.description: The life of a mitt is not easy. More than any other part of your riding kit, mitts have the most contact with the elements. With that in mind, the Burton team chooses the women's bestselling Burton GORE-TEX Mitt + Gore warm technology. DRYRIDE 2L fabric, and a GUARANTEED TO KEEP YOU DRY GORE-TEX membrane protect this Thermacore insulated mitt from the worst weather conditions. The Screen Grab synthetic leather palm gives you full coverage touchscreen control using tech that will never fray, wear out, or wash off. A removable four-way stretch fleece liner dries quickly and gives you options for any weather. Wear just the liner when shoveling, just the shell in sloppy spring conditions, or combine the two for total midwinter warmth and comfort.
feature_bullets: Screen Grab Toughgrip Palm for Total Touchscreen Control
